ygData.subject: Re: Patch Problem
ygData.msgSnippet: ... thing not an EQ thing. Try re-installing Windows over your current Windows. A lot of the time that will fix things. Remember you will lose any
ygData.messageBody:
--- In theeverquesttavern@y..., "Orion" <orionv@c...> wrote:
> Kernel32 is a pain. I have had that happen to me...it is a Windows
thing not an EQ thing. Try re-installing Windows over your current
Windows. A lot of the time that will fix things. Remember you will
lose any screeensavers,etc...you have in your Windows files. And
anything you have saved on the desktop. Be sure and do your backups
and good luck...:>

------------------------

Actually, depends. Installing Windows over itself can work but it
depends on what Windows version you've got.

I wouldn't do it except as a last resort in Windows 98. Can't be 95
or below cause EQ doesn't work.

XP and ME are better bets for install over itself but you have to
worry about like driver, system file stuff... etc. But supposedly
there's a lot fewer problems with that. I've just never tried it.

There's all sorts of stuff you can do to try to pull the system back
up-- but most rely on being able to get into safe mode...

There's system restore, msconfig stuff, etc.

Also you can try the old scanreg /restore in dos trick but that's
harder to do in ME. I can't remember the exact trick. *pouts* It is
possible though I've heard a lot say it no longer is in ME and XP.
*shrugs* I am not 100% positive for XP but know ME does have a way
for sure and am fairly sure though more along 65% type of sure...

Oh well. Hope that helped.

shooman out
Fatedhue Prismatic of the Drinal server.
